name: Hanoi3Agents15DisksInstance3
author: Human

private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E
Disk labels A..O indicate size with A smallest and O largest
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the global configuration where disk A ends on the right peg and the remaining disks remain on the left peg in order.

private_information: I can move disks F, G, H, I, J
Disk labels A..O indicate size with A smallest and O largest
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the global configuration where disk A ends on the right peg and the remaining disks remain on the left peg in order.

private_information: I can move disks K, L, M, N, O
Disk labels A..O indicate size with A smallest and O largest
agent_3.goal: Help achieve the global configuration where disk A ends on the right peg and the remaining disks remain on the left peg in order.

private_information: I coordinate agents agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3
I must produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and problem that capture the multi-agent constraints and primitive moves
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move proposals and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global configuration.

rules.stack_order: Smaller disk cannot be placed underneath a larger disk
rules.legal_moves: Only move the top disk of any peg to another peg if it does not violate stack_order
rules.agent_restrictions: Each agent may only move the disks listed in their private information

public_information: This is a three-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 15 disks labeled A through O, A is smallest and O is largest.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has disks (top->bottom) B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle peg is empty. Right peg has disk A on top.
Only the top disk of a peg may be moved, and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Given the public environment information and the Tower of Hanoi rules, produce an ordered list of primitive moves needed from your perspective. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that obey the rules.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Based on the initial and goal configurations and your private ability to move disks A-E, list the minimal ordered primitive moves you will perform to help reach the global goal. Use the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are needed, return an empty list.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move only disks F, G, H, I, J. Given the public environment information and the Tower of Hanoi rules, produce an ordered list of primitive moves needed from your perspective. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that obey the rules.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Based on the initial and goal configurations and your private ability to move disks F-J, list the minimal ordered primitive moves you will perform to help reach the global goal. Use the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are needed, return an empty list.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can move only disks K, L, M, N, O. Given the public environment information and the Tower of Hanoi rules, produce an ordered list of primitive moves needed from your perspective. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves that you are allowed to perform and that obey the rules.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_3. Based on the initial and goal configurations and your private ability to move disks K-O, list the minimal ordered primitive moves you will perform to help reach the global goal. Use the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are needed, return an empty list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Collect the move proposals from the agents and produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and PDDL problem encoding the three pegs, the 15 disks, the Tower of Hanoi rules, and agentspecific action constraints. Keep actions of different agents distinct and name them clearly. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver in your PDDL modeling choices.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the move lists from the three agents, resolve any conflicts, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem that captures the initial state and the goal state for the FastDownwards solver. Ensure agent actions are distinct and reflect which agent can move which disks. If some agents provide empty move lists, still produce a correct PDDL model that allows the orchestrator's plan to succeed.

expected_solution: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
